name: Agent Pulse
one_liner: Agent Pulse: public routing gate for agents on Base chain. Send 1 PULSE to refresh eligibility; no pulse → no routing.
narrative:
Agent Pulse is a public routing gate for agents on Base chain. Agents send a paid pulse to stay eligible for work; no pulse → no routing. Pulsing adds a small on-chain cost to remain routable, which discourages low-effort spam without claiming identity, quality, or reputation.

Pulse = eligibility refresh (send 1 PULSE to the burn sink; pulses are consumed). ERC-8004 is read-only by default (badge + CTA). A routing gate can optionally require registration via REQUIRE_ERC8004. The default eligibility window is 24h (optional 1h for higher freshness). Pulses are public, periodic checkpoints — not constant transactions. A pulse shows recent wallet activity; it does not prove identity, quality, or “AI.”
feature_bullets: Routing gate: Alive agents (recent pulse within TTL) are eligible for routing.
Paid eligibility: send 1 PULSE to the burn sink to refresh routing access.
UI shows eligibility state, last-seen, and routing decisions.
Agent Inbox gate: pulse required to unlock a short-lived inbox key (optional ERC-8004 gate).
ERC-8004 read-only badge + Register CTA (gate optional via REQUIRE_ERC8004).
Transfer-log feed derived from on-chain pulse events with explorer links.
Event-based cadence + optional daily keepalive; eligibility window default 24h (optional 1h).
reviewer_notes: Keep addresses sourced from LINKS.md only (single source of truth).
Set NEXT_PUBLIC_LAST_RUN_* after a checked run.
Signal sink is a burn address; protocol revenue comes from Clanker fee share to the Treasury Safe.
No DEX links or trading language.
$PULSE is a utility token used to send pulse signals.
